wikipedia_page.main:
Roland Degg (10 February 1909 – 2001) was a World War II English officer. As a field officer he attained the rank of Lieutenant Colonel temporarily, when he took command of the 38th column of the South Staffordshires Regiment in Japanese-held Myanmar (Burma) during 1944.
Degg was awarded a Distinguished Service Order (DSO) because of his command of the 1st Battalion of the South Staffordshire Regiment during World War II

response: *Roland Degg (1909–2001), British battalion commander during World War II
